articles.title: Northern lights may be visible in 14 US states Oct. 28-29
articles.author: Daisy Dobrijevic
articles.fullContent:
Northern lights may be visible in 14 US states Oct. 28-29

By Daisy DobrijevicOct 28, 20253 min read

A moderate geomagnetic storm could make the northern lights visible across 14 U.S. states tonight and tomorrow night, offering a rare skywatching opportunity for millions.

Forecasters at NOAA's Space Weather Prediction Center are predicting a G2-level geomagnetic storm due to fast solar winds from a coronal hole interacting with Earth's magnetic field. This could push the aurora farther south than usual, making it potentially visible in states from Washington to New York.

States in Viewing Area

  • Alaska
  • Washington
  • Idaho
  • Montana
  • North Dakota
  • South Dakota
  • Minnesota
  • Wisconsin
  • Michigan
  • Wyoming
  • Iowa
  • New York
  • Vermont
  • New Hampshire

How to Watch

For the best chance of seeing the aurora, find a location with dark skies away from city lights and look north. The prime viewing time is typically between midnight and 2 a.m. local time. Patience is key, as auroral displays can be faint and intermittent.

Key Takeaways

  • A moderate (G2) geomagnetic storm is predicted for October 28-29.
  • The northern lights may be visible in up to 14 U.S. states.
  • Best viewing is in dark, north-facing locations between midnight and 2 a.m.

Read the full article at Space.com

articles.title: ESA's lunar lander on a simulated moon | Space photo of the day for Oct 28, 2025

articles.fullContent:
ESA's lunar lander on a simulated moon | Space photo of the day for Oct 28, 2025

By Space.comOct 28, 20251 min read

Today's photo of the day features the European Space Agency's (ESA) lunar lander prototype, poised in a meticulously crafted moon-like environment. The testbed is designed to simulate the harsh lighting and terrain conditions the lander will face at the lunar south pole.

This testing is a critical step in preparing for future European missions to the Moon, ensuring the lander's navigation and landing systems can operate flawlessly in one of the most challenging and scientifically promising regions of the lunar surface.

articles.title: The AI Bubble Will Burst
articles.author: Wired Staff
articles.fullContent:
The AI Bubble Will Burst

By Wired StaffOct 27, 20254 min read

Massive investments and sky-high valuations in the generative AI sector are showing classic signs of a financial bubble that may be poised to burst, according to market analysts and tech industry veterans.

The rapid rise of companies in the AI space, fueled by intense hype and speculative investment, mirrors the dot-com boom of the late 1990s. While the technology itself is transformative, concerns are growing that current market valuations have outpaced realistic profitability timelines, creating significant risk for investors and the broader economy.

"There is a real risk that an AI bubble will burst at some point, leading to significant losses for investors."

— Hawkinvest, Market Analyst

Warning Signs

  • Extreme valuations with price-to-earnings ratios exceeding 500.
  • Market concentration in a few mega-cap tech stocks.
  • Circular financing deals where AI companies invest in each other.
  • A significant gap between market hype and actual profitability for most AI startups.

Lessons From the Past

The dot-com crash of 2000 serves as a cautionary tale. Many innovative companies failed, not because their ideas were bad, but because their valuations were unsustainable. Similarly, while AI is undoubtedly here to stay, many current AI-focused companies may not survive a market correction if their business models aren't fundamentally sound.

Key Takeaways

  • The generative AI market is showing signs of a financial bubble.
  • Valuations may be outpacing real-world profitability.
  • A potential market correction could see many AI startups fail.
  • The long-term impact of AI remains significant, but short-term market volatility is a growing concern.

Read the full article at Wired

articles.title: Defense startup Pytho AI wants to turbocharge military mission planning and it will show off its tech at Disrupt 2025
articles.author: TechCrunch
articles.fullContent:
Defense startup Pytho AI wants to turbocharge military mission planning at Disrupt 2025

By TechCrunchOct 27, 20253 min read

Defense startup Pytho AI is set to showcase its AI-powered platform designed to dramatically accelerate military mission planning at the upcoming TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 conference.

The company's technology aims to automate and optimise complex logistical and strategic planning processes, reducing planning times from days or weeks to mere hours. By processing vast amounts of data, including intelligence reports, terrain analysis, and asset availability, Pytho AI provides commanders with data-driven recommendations for optimal courses of action.

Key Capabilities

  • Automated analysis of intelligence and environmental data.
  • Rapid generation and simulation of multiple mission plans.
  • Optimisation of resource allocation and troop movements.
  • Real-time adjustments based on evolving battlefield conditions.

The Need for Speed

In modern warfare, the speed of decision-making can be a decisive factor. Pytho AI's platform is designed to give military planners a significant advantage by compressing the OODA loop (Observe, Orient, Decide, Act). This allows for more agile and responsive operations in rapidly changing environments.

Key Takeaways

  • Pytho AI is a defense startup using AI to speed up military planning.
  • The technology will be demonstrated at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025.
  • The platform aims to reduce mission planning time from weeks to hours.
  • It provides a strategic advantage by enabling faster, data-driven decisions.

Read the full article at TechCrunch

articles.title: How to Interview the Founder of an AI Startup
articles.author: Wired Staff
articles.fullContent:
How to Interview the Founder of an AI Startup

By Wired StaffOct 27, 20253 min read

Cutting through the hype in the AI industry requires asking the right questions. This guide offers key insights into interviewing AI startup founders to uncover the substance behind their claims.

Amidst a sea of buzzwords and ambitious promises, it's crucial for journalists, investors, and potential employees to distinguish genuine innovation from well-marketed fiction. The focus should be on understanding the core technology, the problem it solves, and the company's sustainable competitive advantage.

"The most important question is often the simplest: What problem are you actually solving, and for whom?"

— Anonymous VC

Key Questions to Ask

  • What is your proprietary technology vs. what is built on third-party APIs?
  • What is your unique data source or data advantage?
  • How do you measure the accuracy and reliability of your model?
  • What are the specific use cases where your product is already delivering value?

Beyond the Tech

Beyond the technical details, it's vital to probe the founder's vision, the team's expertise, and the company's ethical framework. Understanding how a startup plans to navigate the complex ethical landscape of AI can be as telling as understanding their algorithm.

Read the full article at Wired

articles.title: The Unbearable Smugness of the AI Press Release
articles.author: Wired Staff
articles.fullContent:
The Unbearable Smugness of the AI Press Release

By Wired StaffOct 27, 20253 min read

A profile of Ed Zitron, a public relations professional who has become a vocal critic of the overblown and often misleading claims made in press releases from AI companies.

Zitron argues that the current wave of AI-related PR is filled with jargon, unsubstantiated claims of revolutionising industries, and a general lack of substance. He advocates for a more grounded and honest approach to communicating about technology, one that focuses on real-world applications and tangible benefits rather than vague promises of a utopian future.

"We're drowning in a sea of press releases that say nothing. They promise to change the world but can't explain how they'll improve a single workflow."

— Ed Zitron

Key Takeaways

  • There is a critique of the current state of public relations in the AI industry.
  • Many AI press releases are accused of being vague and overhyped.
  • The focus should be on clear communication about real-world applications.
  • Ed Zitron is a key voice calling for more accountability in tech PR.

Read the full article at Wired

articles.title: Skyline Nav AI's software can guide you anywhere without GPS, find it at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
articles.author: TechCrunch
articles.fullContent:
Skyline Nav AI's software can guide you anywhere without GPS

By TechCrunchOct 27, 20253 min read

Skyline Nav AI, a startup presenting at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, has developed a visual navigation system that can determine location and provide directions without relying on GPS signals.

The company's Pathfinder software uses computer vision to analyse its surroundings—such as buildings, trees, and other landmarks—and matches them against a vast database to generate real-time navigation. This technology is crucial for applications where GPS is unavailable or unreliable, including indoor environments, urban canyons, or in defense scenarios where signals may be jammed.

Key Features

  • Operates without GPS or other satellite signals.
  • Uses computer vision to identify location based on visual landmarks.
  • Provides real-time navigation for drones, vehicles, or individuals.
  • Applicable in GPS-denied environments for commercial and defense use.

Disrupting Navigation

By offering a robust alternative to GPS, Skyline Nav AI is targeting a critical vulnerability in modern logistics, transportation, and defense systems. The ability to navigate visually opens up new possibilities for autonomous systems and enhances operational resilience. The company will be showcasing its technology as part of the Startup Battlefield at the conference.

Read the full article at TechCrunch

articles.title: Biotech Nephrogen combines AI and gene therapy to reverse kidney disease, check it out at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
articles.author: Marina Temkin
articles.fullContent:
Nephrogen combines AI and gene therapy to reverse kidney disease

By Marina TemkinOct 27, 20254 min read

Biotech startup Nephrogen has introduced a novel approach to treating kidney disease by combining artificial intelligence with gene therapy, a technology it will showcase as a finalist at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025's Startup Battlefield.

The company, founded by Demetri Maxim out of personal experience with his mother's kidney failure and his own genetic predisposition to Polycystic Kidney Disease (PKD), aims to reverse kidney damage rather than just manage its symptoms. Nephrogen's platform uses AI to identify diseased kidney cells and engineers a targeted delivery system for gene-editing drugs.

"After three years of research and development, Maxim asserts that Nephrogen has built a delivery system that is a hundred times more effective at getting medication to the kidney than the FDA-approved methods currently available."

— TechCrunch Reporting

Key Data & Insights

  • Over 850 million people worldwide are affected by kidney disease.
  • Nephrogen's technology uses AI for precise targeting of diseased cells.
  • The company's gene therapy aims to correct genetic issues at the cellular level.
  • Nephrogen is a finalist in the Startup Battlefield at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025.

A Personal Mission

Maxim's motivation stems from his family's battle with PKD, a genetic condition. Witnessing his mother go through dialysis and a transplant fueled his drive to find a cure. This personal connection underpins the company's mission to offer a revolutionary alternative to traditional, often burdensome, treatments for kidney disease.

Read the full article at TechCrunch

articles.title: Scientists discover 3 Earth-size exoplanets that may have double sunsets
articles.author: Robert Lea
articles.fullContent:
Scientists discover 3 Earth-size exoplanets that may have double sunsets

By Robert LeaOct 27, 20254 min read

Astronomers have discovered a record-breaking system of three Earth-sized worlds orbiting a pair of cool dwarf stars, making it the first binary system known to host transiting planets around both of its stellar components.

Using NASA's Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS), the team identified the unique planetary arrangement in the system TOI-2267, located about 73.5 light-years away. This discovery challenges existing theories that suggest such compact binary systems are hostile to the formation of complex planetary arrangements.

"This makes TOI-2267 the first binary system known to host transiting planets around both of its stars."

— Dr. Sebastián Zúñiga-Fernández, University of Liège

A Landmark System

The discovery is significant because it provides a unique natural laboratory for testing the limits of planet formation models. The two confirmed planets and one candidate are all roughly the size of Earth and orbit their respective host stars in tight, rapid orbits of just a few days. Future observations with telescopes like the James Webb Space Telescope could allow scientists to measure the planets' masses and study their atmospheric chemistry.

Key Takeaways

  • Three Earth-sized exoplanets were found in a compact binary star system.
  • It is the first time transiting planets have been found orbiting both stars in a binary pair.
  • The discovery challenges current models of planet formation.
  • The system, TOI-2267, will be a prime target for follow-up atmospheric studies.

Read the full article at Space.com

articles.title: This Week in Space podcast: Episode 183 — Lunar Lander Wanted! Apply Within
articles.author: Space.com Staff
articles.fullContent:
This Week in Space: Lunar Lander Wanted! Apply Within

By Space.com StaffOct 27, 20252 min read

On the latest episode of the 'This Week in Space' podcast, hosts Rod Pyle and Tariq Malik discuss the major news that NASA is reopening the contract for the Artemis III lunar lander.

The decision, announced by acting NASA Administrator Sean Duffy, comes amid concerns that SpaceX's Starship Human Landing System may not be ready in time to meet the administration's goal of landing astronauts on the moon before China does. This move opens the door for other aerospace companies to bid on developing a second lander to ensure redundancy and a timely return to the lunar surface.

"Lander, lander, who's got the lander? ...there is concern that SpaceX may not be able to fulfill their commitment before China's announced landing date of 2030."

— Rod Pyle & Tariq Malik, This Week in Space

Read the full article at Space.com

articles.title: Space radiation can produce some organic molecules on icy moons
articles.author: Javier Barbuzano
articles.fullContent:
Space radiation can produce some organic molecules on icy moons

By Javier BarbuzanoOct 26, 20251 min read

New laboratory research indicates that some organic molecules found in the plumes of Saturn's moon Enceladus could be the result of natural radiation, complicating the search for life.

This discovery may require scientists to reassess the astrobiological significance of these compounds, as they may not originate from the moon’s subsurface ocean as previously hoped. As future missions prepare to visit ocean worlds like Enceladus and Europa, researchers will need to develop methods to distinguish between organics created by radiation and those that might genuinely indicate a habitable environment.

Key Takeaways

  • Space radiation can form organic molecules on icy moons.
  • This discovery complicates the search for life, as these molecules may not be from biological sources.
  • Future space missions will need to differentiate between radiation-formed and potentially life-indicating organics.

Read the full article at space.com

articles.title: Real Estate Is Entering Its AI Slop Era
articles.author: Kat Tenbarge
articles.fullContent:
Real Estate Is Entering Its AI Slop Era

Fake video walk-throughs, magically expanding lofts, and stair hallucinations are just some of the new AI-generated features house hunters are encountering in property listings.

As you hunt through real estate listings, you might find vertical videos showing off expansive rooms with perfect lighting and an unnatural glide. Increasingly, these are not real; real estate agents are using AI to generate videos and virtually stage homes, often without disclosing it to potential buyers.

“That’s because, increasingly, it’s not real.” — Kat Tenbarge

Data & Insights

AI is being used to generate videos and virtually stage homes for real estate listings. This is often done without disclosure to potential buyers, leading to misleading representations of properties.

Broader Impact

The undisclosed use of AI in real estate marketing raises ethical questions and has the potential to mislead consumers, creating a gap between the digital representation and the physical reality of a property.

Key Takeaways

  • AI-generated content like video walk-throughs and virtual staging is becoming common in real estate.
  • This content often goes undisclosed, creating unrealistic expectations for buyers.
  • The trend highlights a new era of AI-driven marketing with potential ethical pitfalls.

articles.title: 'No spacecraft would survive': Europe simulates catastrophic solar storm
articles.author: Samantha Mathewson
articles.fullContent:
'No spacecraft would survive': Europe simulates catastrophic solar storm

Europe has conducted its most extreme space weather simulation to date, revealing a scenario so severe that no spacecraft was left unscathed.

The simulation was part of the European Space Agency's (ESA) annual Space Weather Week and was designed to test the continent's readiness for a worst-case-scenario solar storm.

“The results were sobering: a powerful coronal mass ejection (CME) from the sun could knock out satellites, disrupt power grids, and endanger astronauts.” — Samantha Mathewson

Data & Insights

The simulation tested a worst-case-scenario solar storm, a powerful coronal mass ejection (CME), which showed the potential to disable satellites, disrupt power grids, and pose a danger to astronauts.

Broader Impact

The findings from this simulation underscore the significant and widespread risks posed by extreme solar weather, highlighting the need for improved preparedness and mitigation strategies to protect critical infrastructure in space and on Earth.

Key Takeaways

  • Europe ran its most extreme space weather simulation, with dire results.
  • The simulated solar storm was so severe it would leave no spacecraft operational.
  • The exercise highlights the urgent need for strategies to counter the effects of a catastrophic solar event.

articles.title: How AI can improve storm surge forecasts to help save lives
articles.author: Navid Tahvildari
articles.fullContent:
How AI can improve storm surge forecasts to help save lives

Artificial intelligence models offer the potential to improve hurricane and storm surge forecasting, giving coastal communities faster and more detailed warnings about oncoming risks.

Hurricanes are America’s most destructive natural hazards, with storm surge being the number one cause of damages and deaths. Accurate predictions are critical for evacuations and emergency preparations.

“As artificial intelligence models rapidly spread through every aspect of our lives and more data becomes available for training them, the technology offers potential to improve hurricane and storm surge forecasting in the future.” — Navid Tahvildari

Data & Insights

Since 1980, hurricanes have caused over US$1.5 trillion in damage and killed more than 7,000 people in the United States. Storm surge is the leading cause of these devastating impacts.

Broader Impact

By leveraging AI for more accurate and timely storm surge forecasts, emergency responders can be better prepared, and coastal residents can be given crucial extra time to evacuate, ultimately saving lives and reducing property damage.

Key Takeaways

  • AI technology has the potential to significantly improve storm surge forecasting.
  • Better forecasts can lead to more effective evacuations and emergency response.
  • Storm surge is the primary cause of death and damage from hurricanes in the U.S.

articles.title: The glaring security risks with AI browser agents
articles.author: isave1g5
articles.fullContent:
The Glaring Security Risks with AI Browser Agents

As artificial intelligence continues to advance, AI browser agents are becoming increasingly sophisticated. However, with this sophistication comes significant security vulnerabilities that organizations and individuals must address.

Understanding AI Browser Agents

AI browser agents are automated tools that can navigate websites, fill out forms, and perform complex web-based tasks on behalf of users. While these capabilities offer tremendous convenience and efficiency, they also open new attack vectors for malicious actors.

Key Security Concerns

Security experts have identified several critical vulnerabilities:

  • Data Interception: AI agents may inadvertently expose sensitive information during automated browsing sessions.
  • Credential Theft: Stored credentials used by AI agents can become prime targets for cybercriminals.
  • Session Hijacking: Automated sessions may be more vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks.
  • Malicious Redirection: AI agents might be manipulated to visit phishing sites or download malware.

Mitigation Strategies

Organizations implementing AI browser agents should consider the following security measures:

  1. Implement robust authentication protocols
  2. Use encrypted communication channels
  3. Regularly audit AI agent activities
  4. Establish strict access controls
  5. Deploy advanced threat detection systems
"The convenience of AI browser agents must be balanced with rigorous security protocols. Organizations cannot afford to overlook these emerging threats." - Cybersecurity Expert

Looking Forward

As AI browser agents become more prevalent, the cybersecurity community must stay vigilant. Continued research, collaboration, and innovation in security practices will be essential to protect users and organizations from evolving threats.

The integration of AI into our daily digital activities is inevitable, but it must be done responsibly with security at the forefront of development and deployment strategies.

articles.title: New moon explained: What is it and when is the next one?
articles.author: Daisy Dobrijevic
articles.fullContent:
New moon explained: What is it and when is the next one?

By Daisy DobrijevicOct 24, 20254 min read

The new moon is the first phase in the monthly lunar cycle, occurring when the Moon and Sun have the same ecliptic longitude. At this stage, the lunar disk is not visible to the naked eye as the sunlit side of the Moon is facing away from Earth.

This phase marks the beginning of a new cycle of waxing and waning. While the astronomical new moon is technically the moment of conjunction, the term is often used to describe the first visible crescent moon, which appears shortly after sunset. This first sliver of the Moon has historically been used to mark the beginning of months in many lunar and lunisolar calendars, such as the Islamic calendar.

Observing the New Moon

Because the new moon is invisible, it provides the darkest skies of the month, making it an ideal time for stargazing and observing deep-sky objects like galaxies and nebulae. The next new moon will occur on November 20, 2025. The complete cycle from one new moon to the next, known as a synodic month, takes approximately 29.5 days.

Key Takeaways

  • The new moon is the first phase of the lunar cycle when the Moon is not visible.
  • It occurs when the Moon is positioned between the Earth and the Sun.
  • This phase provides the darkest skies, which is optimal for astronomy.
  • The term can also refer to the first visible crescent after the astronomical new moon.

Read the full article at Space.com

articles.title: A comprehensive list of 2025 tech layoffs
articles.author: Jack Turner
articles.fullContent:
A comprehensive list of 2025 tech layoffs

While widespread hiring freezes are less common than in previous years, companies are making targeted cuts to enhance operational efficiency and to free up resources for strategic AI initiatives.

Key Takeaways

  • Companies are focusing on targeted restructuring rather than broad hiring freezes.

articles.title: How compact can a neutron star get before collapsing into a black hole?
articles.author: Keith Cooper
articles.fullContent:
How compact can a neutron star get before collapsing into a black hole?

Neutron stars are the densest objects in the universe, but there's a limit to how massive they can get before they collapse into a black hole, and two independent teams of researchers have provided a new estimate for this limit.

As the crushed remnants of massive stars that exploded as supernovae, neutron stars pack more mass than our sun into a sphere no wider than a city, making them incredibly dense.

“Exactly where that limit lies is a mystery, but two independent teams of researchers have now provided a new estimate for it.” — Keith Cooper

Data & Insights

Neutron stars can contain more mass than the sun within a diameter equivalent to the width of a city. New research from two separate teams has offered a new estimate for the mass limit before they collapse.

Broader Impact

Determining the precise mass limit for neutron stars is crucial for understanding the final stages of stellar evolution, the formation of black holes, and the fundamental properties of matter under extreme conditions.

Key Takeaways

  • Neutron stars have a mass limit beyond which they collapse into black holes.
  • Two research teams have independently provided a new estimate for this critical limit.
  • These objects are the densest in the universe, formed from supernova explosions.

articles.title: Perth fundraiser to repatriate Irish expat raises staggering amount
articles.author: PerthNow
articles.fullContent:
Perth fundraiser to repatriate Irish expat raises staggering amount

By PerthNowOct 23, 20251 min read

A GoFundMe page to repatriate the body of Serena Downey, a 28-year-old Irish woman who passed away suddenly in Western Australia, has raised over $100,000 in less than 24 hours.

Ms. Downey, who had been a FIFO worker in the state for six years, is remembered fondly by friends and family. The fundraiser was established to help ease the significant financial burden on her family for transporting her body and belongings back to her hometown in Ireland, demonstrating a massive outpouring of community support.

Fundraiser Snapshot

articles.title: Egypt's Forbidden Archaeological Site: Military Lockdown Hides Complex
articles.author: Ancient Origins
articles.fullContent:
Egypt's Forbidden Archaeological Site: Military Lockdown Hides Complex

By Ancient OriginsOct 23, 20251 min read

The archaeological site of Zawyet El Aryan, located near the Giza Pyramids, has been a restricted military zone since the 1960s, preventing any modern investigation into its mysterious underground structures.

Often nicknamed “Egypt’s Area 51,” the lockdown has prevented archaeologists from conducting modern studies on its enigmatic features, which include a massive pit lined with granite blocks. Many Egyptologists believe the site could be an unfinished pyramid complex dating back to the 3rd or 4th Dynasty, leaving its true purpose and contents a mystery.

Key Points

  • The Zawyet El Aryan site has been a restricted military zone since the 1960s.
  • This has blocked modern archaeological research of its large underground structures.
  • The site is speculated to be an unfinished pyramid from the Old Kingdom.

Read the full article at Ancient Origins

articles.title: Mariah Carey Arrives in Perth for First WA Performance in Over a Decade
articles.author: Kellie Balaam
articles.fullContent:
Mariah Carey Arrives in Perth for First WA Performance in Over a Decade

The legendary Mariah Carey, known worldwide as the "Songbird Supreme," has touched down in Perth for her highly anticipated performance—her first in Western Australia in more than ten years. Fans across the state are buzzing with excitement as the five-time Grammy winner prepares to take the stage.

A Long-Awaited Return

Perth music enthusiasts have been eagerly awaiting this moment since the announcement earlier this year. Carey's last performance in WA was over a decade ago, making this concert a historic event for local fans.

What to Expect

The concert promises to be a spectacular showcase of Carey's incredible career, spanning over three decades of chart-topping hits. Fans can expect to hear:

  • Classic hits like "Hero" and "Vision of Love"
  • Holiday favorites including "All I Want for Christmas Is You"
  • Fan-favorite ballads showcasing her legendary five-octave vocal range
  • Recent releases and surprise performances

Concert Details

Venue: RAC Arena, Perth
Date: October 25, 2025
Doors Open: 6:30 PM
Show Starts: 8:00 PM

Economic Impact

The arrival of such a high-profile international artist is expected to provide a significant boost to Perth's entertainment and hospitality sectors. Hotels near the venue have reported high occupancy rates, and local restaurants are preparing for increased patronage.

"Having Mariah Carey perform in Perth is a testament to our city's growing status as a world-class entertainment destination. This is exactly the kind of event that puts Perth on the international touring map." - Tourism Minister

Fan Reactions

Social media has been ablaze with excitement since Carey's plane touched down at Perth Airport. Long-time fans have shared their memories of her previous Perth performances, while a new generation of admirers can't wait to experience her legendary vocals live for the first time.

Local fan clubs have organized meet-ups before the concert, and some dedicated supporters have been camping outside the venue for days to secure prime viewing positions.

A Career of Excellence

With over 200 million records sold worldwide, 19 number-one singles on the Billboard Hot 100, and countless accolades, Mariah Carey remains one of the best-selling music artists of all time. Her influence on pop and R&B music is immeasurable, and her Perth performance is sure to be an unforgettable celebration of her remarkable legacy.

For Perth residents and visitors alike, this concert represents a once-in-a-decade opportunity to witness one of music's greatest voices in an intimate setting. As the countdown to showtime continues, the excitement in the air is palpable.

articles.title: Quantum 'echoes' reveal Google's quantum computer potential
articles.author: Emily Conover
articles.fullContent:
Quantum 'echoes' reveal Google's quantum computer potential

By Emily ConoverOct 22, 20251 min read

Google’s Willow quantum chip has achieved a significant milestone by demonstrating verifiable quantum advantage, performing a calculation that is reportedly beyond the capabilities of even the most powerful traditional supercomputers.

Crucially, the result of the calculation—which measures a phenomenon known as “quantum echoes”—can be verified for correctness. This verification is a vital step toward the practical and reliable application of quantum computers for real-world problems. According to the report in Nature, the calculation ran 13,000 times faster on the Willow chip than it would on the Frontier supercomputer.

Key Data & Insights

  • Google's Willow chip has demonstrated verifiable quantum advantage.
  • It performed a calculation 13,000 times faster than the Frontier supercomputer.
  • The ability to verify the result is a critical step for practical quantum computing.
